intro: Pteroneurum cupanii, commonly known as the cupanioid mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and has a distinctive appearance with small, leathery leaves and white, fleshy berries. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its haustoria, which penetrate the host's vascular system. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in forest canopies. Its botanical characteristics make it an important part of the ecological interactions within its habitat.
